quizzes.question: Why has the character-counting code been put in a function?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Text Analyzer[/h1]

This part of the program shows a function that counts how many times a character occurs in a string. [code format="py"]def count_char(text, char):
  count = 0
  for c in text:
    if c == char:
      count += 1
  return count[/code]
This function takes as its arguments the text of the file and one character, returning the number of times that character appears in the text.
Now we can call it for our file. [code format="py"]filename = input("Enter a filename: ")
with open(filename) as f:
  text = f.read()

[b]print(count_char(text, "r"))[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [code format="raw"]>>>
Enter a filename: test.txt
83
>>>[/code]
[note]The character "r" appears 83 times in the file.[/note]

answers.text: To reduce the number of digits printed

quizzes.question: What is the purpose of the round function in the code?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Text Analyzer [/h1]

The next part of the program finds what percentage of the text each character of the alphabet occupies. [code format="py" ] for char in "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz":
  perc = 100 * count_char(text, char) / len(text)
  print("{0} - {1}%".format(char, round(perc, 2)))[/code]
Let's put it all together and run the program: [code format="py" codeId="380"]def count_char(text, char):
  count = 0
  for c in text:
    if c == char:
      count += 1
  return count

filename = input("Enter a filename: ")
with open(filename) as f:
  text = f.read()

for char in "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz":
  perc = 100 * count_char(text, char) / len(text)
  print("{0} - {1}%".format(char, round(perc, 2)))[/code]
[b]Result:[/b][code format="raw" ]Enter a filename: test.txt
a - 4.68%
b - 4.94%
c - 2.28%
...[/code]
